programmes.show_description: The Goggleboxers watch Gladiators, The Summit, Michael McIntyre's Big Show, Bridgerton, Guy Martin's House without Bills, Dogs Behaving (Very) Badly and BBC News (Mandelson).

programmes.show_name: Super Surgeons: A Chance at Life
programmes.show_description: The series that goes behind the scenes at world-leading cancer hospital the Royal Marsden. Aspiring midwife Anthea has a difficult tumour that could lead to arm amputation.
...Crisp Factory: It's crunch time, as one of Britain's best-known brands launches its latest crisp flavour. From soil to shelf, we tear into the journey of how Walkers' new crisp is born.
Jamie makes gnarly celeriac skewers, a hearty spiced cauliflower bake complete with an edible lid, a steaming winter chilli, crispy potato and chickpea parcels and soul-warming soup. (Ep6)
Rose Matafeo joins Joe Lycett for mischief in Malmö. They visit the world's first twisting tower and the Disgusting Food Museum and sample insects and a spirit made from beaver glands.
Teleshopping.
Teleshopping.

programmes.show_name: Kirstie and Phil's Love It or
programmes.show_description: List It: Brilliant Builds: Kirstie and Phil look back at one of their biggest builds - Paul and Dawn's higgledy-piggledy Huddersfield home - where Kirstie got the sledgehammer out!
Reading. Sonya Smith hopes to disguise her lack of cooking ability with her good humour and a 'touch of sparkle'. But with kitchen calamities galore, what will her guests think? (Ep1/5)
Reading. Cockney Glen Wilkie is confident that his menu will be a winner. But his evening goes from disaster to disaster, with tears at the table when he serves his main. (Ep2/5)
Reading. It's all hands on deck as Richard Howse's girlfriend Katy plans his pirate-themed night. But Sonya isn't convinced by the gluten-free fare and Sabi refuses the meaty main. (Ep3/5)
Reading. Sabi Phagura hosts a bhangra-themed evening with traditional Indian food, but can she succeed despite Glen's efforts to wind everyone up? (Ep4/5)
Reading. Corset maker Serine Daou hopes her burlesque night will end the competition on a high. But her gourmet burgers aren't very gourmet, and Glen doesn't like the entertainment. (Ep5/5)

programmes.show_name: Kirstie and Phil's Love It or...
programmes.show_description: ...List It: Joanne and Nick are in a standoff over their bursting bungalow in Scorton. Can Kirstie turn compact into impact, or will an awe-inspiring 'Spencer special' triumph?
George explores a stargazing cabin with a twist in Devon, a vintage horsebox being transformed into a mobile performance space, and a Norwegian Viking-inspired longhouse.
In south London, Kirstie and Phil help Jess and Zak, who've viewed over 60 properties to no avail, and self-professed oldest first-time buyers in town Rachel and Alan.
Paul dreams of owning a Spanish holiday home on the Costa Blanca, where he can spend quality time with family. Are any of the places that Ben Hillman shows him 'the one'?
Jasmin and David are moving permanently to the beautiful town of Cómpeta in Andalucía. Can Jasmine Harman find their perfect Spanish place for their budget of £130k?
Annette and Graham explore Spain's northern Costa Blanca to find their dream bolthole for £220k. After a rocky start, is the grass really greener? And will they find their perfect place?
Veronica and Tim search for a bolthole on the stunning Italian Riviera for £220k. After a few tantalising treats give them food for thought, will they find their slice of la dolce vita?
Sarah sees what the Canary Island of Fuerteventura has to offer for £250k, from a beautiful box-ticking bungalow to a sensational semi-detached house. Will she find the perfect place?

programmes.show_name: Kirstie and Phil's Love It or...
programmes.show_description: ...List It: It's a Cullercoats catch-up, as we see how Mark and Suze are getting on after transforming their topsy-turvy townhouse. Do they still have the renovation bug?
...the World: In March 2011, Japan was hit by a devastating tsunami, killing 20,000 and triggering a nuclear meltdown. Survivors and witnesses tell their extraordinary stories. (Ep1)
...the World: In March 2011, a massive tsunami caused a major meltdown at Japan's Fukushima nuclear plant, triggering explosions and evacuations. What went wrong at Fukushima? (Ep2)
Bill's imagination works overtime at Swansea's Grand Theatre as he mixes genius musical parodies with illogical absurdity and bizarre stories from his colourful career.
On the show this time, The Masked Singer, Love Is Blind, Gladiators, Steal, Bargain Holiday Secrets, The Floor and ITV News (Larry the Cat).
This time it's Adolescence, Tribe with Bruce Parry, and Bad Dog Academy. Also Tempting Fortune, The Yorkshire Vet, Million Dollar Secret and ITV News (Greenland/wrestling).
The Drone Unit hook up with the helicopter team and the canine squad to chase a car thief. And a reckless robber makes a rookie error in broad daylight.
The Horror House (Part 2/2): Will the victims of alleged historic child sex abuse finally get justice? Or will the suspect walk free, like he did before?
...Washington DC: Joe Lycett and Phil Wang enjoy DC's wonders, from the Washington Monument to the Barbie Pond, a secret door experience, a donut tour and a gin rickey in a speakeasy.
Teleshopping.
Teleshopping.
Gaynor offers a warm welcome to her guests at the Nateby Inn B&B in Cumbria. A cask-rolling competition turns out to be a barrel of laughs, but one guest hogs the limelight at dinner.
Graham and Julia host at Outfields Farm B&B in Ravensden, Bedfordshire, where they treat their guests to an adrenaline-fuelled afternoon at an indoor skydiving centre.
Bob Osborne takes a laid-back approach to running the At Home B&B in Chiswick, west London. His guests appreciate the art in his communal living space, but they're soon dishing the dirt.
Andrew and Clare host at the Ammonite Lodge guest house in Chard, Somerset, where they hope to bowl their guests over with a traditional game of skittles.
It's the final day of the competition and everyone meets for one last time to settle some scores and find out how much they've been paid and who's been crowned the best B&Bers.
The competition begins at B&B at No.3 in Market Bosworth. Hosts Mac and Jo take pride in their Tudor architecture, but they've got a breakfast bombshell for their guests.
On day two, a topsy-turvy breakfast at Noreen and Chloe's establishment - The Bull Hotel in Buckinghamshire - leaves some of their guests happier than others...
At The Chequers Inn in Battle, East Sussex, Shaun and Kelly aim to please with their historic surroundings and homemade ingredients. But one guest delivers a shock in their feedback.
The last visit is to Hastings House in East Sussex, where Ian and Bev aim to provide an upmarket experience. But according to two guests, that doesn't extend to their towels...
The B&Bers sharpen their knives on payment day as they debate bad breakfasts, miserable mini bars and terrible towels, before the winning B&B is crowned.

programmes.show_name: Find It, Fix It, Flog It
programmes.show_description: Henry Cole and Simon O'Brien head to Suffolk to meet pals John and Jane, who've been collecting and swapping items for many years.
(2016) Toby Jones and Catherine Zeta-Jones lead a stellar cast in a reboot of the comedy classic. The hapless Home Guard platoon gets involved with D-Day. But there's a spy in their midst.
Ben Hillman helps Lisa and Neil fulfil their dream of buying a holiday home on the Costa Cálida to share with their children. With a budget of £100k, can they find the perfect place?
Paul and his daughter Holly see what La Duquesa - at the quieter end of the Costa del Sol - has to offer for £190k. Will a wild card be Paul's perfect place?
Shirley and Ken see what Famagusta has to offer for £175k, from a 'hard no' non-starter to two perfect places that have them moving in already. How will they pick between two dream homes?
...Crisp Factory: It's crunch time, as one of Britain's best-known brands launches its latest crisp flavour. From soil to shelf, we tear into the journey of how Walkers' new crisp is born.
On the show this time, The Masked Singer, Love Is Blind, Gladiators, Steal, Bargain Holiday Secrets, The Floor and ITV News (Larry the Cat).
(2022) Steven Spielberg's coming-of-age drama about a young man who dreams of reshaping the world through the medium of film. Sound familiar? With Michelle Williams and Seth Rogen.
